A: 1. Peaceful Co-existence means different people living together in _ (a) conflict (b) peace (c) silence)
2. Peaceful Co-existence means living together without disagreement or _ (a) fun (b) fight (c) work)
3. Jesus taught us to live _ with others (a) peacefully (b) angrily (c) selfishly)
4. If someone offends us, Jesus advised us to _ them (a) ignore (b) forgive (c) fight)
5. God wants us to live peacefully with others in the _ (a) church (b) community (c) house)
6. Who reconciled after Jacob took his brother's blessings? (a) Isaac and Abimelech (b) Esau and Jacob (c) Philemon and Onesimus)
7. Abraham prevented a quarrel between himself and his _ Lot (a) brother (b) nephew (c) father)
8. It is good to show _ to others (a) anger (b) love (c) indifference)
9. Jesus wants us to show love and _ to people (a) fear (b) hostility (c) hospitality)
10. We should tell others the _ (a) lies (b) truth (c) stories)
11. We should be _ to others (a) closed-minded (b) open-minded (c) critical)
12. Jonathan loved David as his own _ (a) brother (b) friend (c) soul)
13. Who planned to kill David? (a) Jonathan (b) King Saul (c) Samuel)
14. Jonathan saved David by telling him King Saul's _ (a) plans (b) secrets (c) dreams)
15. Jonathan hid David in a place far away from _'s sight (a) David (b) Samuel (c) Saul)
16. Jonathan and David made a _ (a) promise (b) covenant (c) treaty)
17. Pupils and everybody in society should show _ to one another (a) indifference (b) love (c) competition)
18. We should show love to those in _ (a) happiness (b) danger (c) school)
19. We should give help to the _ (a) rich (b) needy (c) strong)
20. One way to show love is to share our _ with others (a) problems (b) belongings (c) opinions)
B: 1. Peaceful Co-existence means different people living together in _________.
2. According to Jesus, if someone offends us, what should we do? _________
3. Name one example from the Bible of people desiring peaceful co-existence. _________
5. What is one way pupils can show love to one another? _________
C: 1. Explain what peaceful co-existence means according to the provided text.
2. Discuss Jesus' teaching on how to respond when someone offends you, in the context of peaceful co-existence.
3. Describe the relationship between Jonathan and David, highlighting how they demonstrated unselfish love.
4. List and briefly explain two ways individuals, including pupils, can demonstrate love and unselfishness in society, as mentioned in the text.
5. Why is it important to tell the truth and be open-minded to people when showing love?
answers_C: Peaceful co-existence means different people living together in peace, without any disagreement or fight.
Jesus advised that if someone offends us, we should forgive them and live happily together, promoting peace.
Jonathan loved David as his own soul. He saved David from King Saul's plans to kill him by warning and hiding him. They made a covenant, showing deep, unselfish love.

1. Share belongings with others. 2. Protect one another when there is danger. These actions demonstrate care and support for others' well-being. 3. Give help to the needy, showing compassion for those less fortunate.
Telling the truth and being open-minded are crucial aspects of showing genuine love and hospitality. It fosters trust and transparency, essential for healthy relationships and peaceful co-existence.
